titleStmt.title: How to revive the Golden Age with the true causes of the vvant of good trading, and money, in these kingdoms; and how yet to remedy them, and to make these kingdoms exceed all others, in riches and power. Humbly presented to the consideration of the Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Hodges, John, fl. 1672-1674.

titleStmt.title: How to revive the Golden Age with the true causes of the vvant of good trading, and money, in these kingdoms; and how yet to remedy them, and to make these kingdoms exceed all others, in riches and power. Humbly presented to the consideration of the Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Hodges, John, fl. 1672-1674.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by H.Bruges for G. Widdows at the Green-Dragon in St. Pauls Church-Yard; where you may see a farther discourse of trade, intituled the True English interest, or an account of the cheif national improvements, demonstrating an infallible advance of this nation, to infinite wealth and greatness, trade and populacy, with imployment and preferment for all persons. By Carew Reynel esq.,

notesStmt.note: At end of text: John Hodges esq;.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: all persons. By Carew Reynel esq.
